column4: aarrgg...pls help me with my printer problem! Can anyone hear me! No one has answered any of my last 6 posts!
what was the question again?
my question is here: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=182784
I am quite sure it is a simple thing I am doing wrong, since I am pretty much a n00b
I simply dont really know the right way to connect to a network printer from ubuntu
try system administration printing, then choose new printer and try network printer see what you can get out of that
but thats what I have done! :-) I have it set up to IPP on the adress that my printer specifies! But nothing happens when I try to print...I can ping it over the network so I have contact...
can you telnet to the printer?
issue the command "telnet IP-For-Printer" and see if you can access it
ok will try, to secs
yes I can...however it then asks me for login information and I dont know what to use....
try root and enter
or point a web browser at the printer also
I have already tried pointing my browser at it...and it works...I get a fine gui where I can see different options!
it was from here that I saw what IPP adress to use...
so can you take a screen shot of that screen and paste it in paste.ubuntu-nl.org
what screen...just the first one that shows when I log on to the printer via the web-browser?
one that offers some configuration options
ok..
here it is: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14780
what are the options under tcp/ip?
I can change its IP-adress in there...
no other issues
no other issues..what do you mean?
